results.title: Surface tension
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Karena Slaninka and Moira Moss
results.brief_description: Freida has something to tell Nick, but she doesn’t know what she feels or how to express it. The unspoken is the source of a tension that grows and grows and eventually must burst like a bubble rising to the surface. Original format 16mm.

results.title: Sex rules
results.brief_description:
Jo and Nik are best friends until they start having to contend with boys and sex. When Jo finds out that her favourite teacher has AIDS, she becomes obsessed with the subject and bases her school artwork on the theme of safe sex. At the same time Nik is becoming involved with a boy and decides to have sex with him without a condom.
Cast features Kirsty McGregor as Jo and Angelica Klages as Nik.

results.title: Road to Alice
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Frances McGivern and Stavros Kazantzidis
results.brief_description: Jimmy (Noah Taylor) owes Dimitri more money than he can spare. He decides that a holiday would be a better bet. On his travels he meets Louis (Hugo Weaving) and things start to go wrong. Cast also includes Helen Buday, Leone Carmen, Angelo D’Angelo, Emil Minty. Best Short Film, AFI Awards (1992). Original format 16mm/colour.

results.title: Lovely
results.brief_description: In Ruth Carr’s arresting vignette, a woman rises every morning to put on her mask for the world, terrified that her husband will glimpse the real face beneath. As the camera explores in stark close-up the landscape of this aging woman’s body, Lovely contemplates on the underbelly of the beauty industry, the ravages of time, and what people will do in the name of love. Cast features Greta Lindholm and Ken Snodgrass.

results.title: Code blue
results.creator_credit: Andrew O'Sullivan, Pascal Guilloux, Moira Moss and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A busy intersection in a large city. Everyone is going about their own business - waiting to cross the road, minding their children…A jay-walker is run over by a courier van. How fast can the city heal itself? ‘Code blue’ is a tightly directed and beautifully paced film which has screened at over 20 festivals throughout the world. The film’s blue tones help to create a tense and emotive ten minute journey through a fast city.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew O’Sullivan, Pascal Guilloux, Moira Moss and AFTRS

results.title: The Beat manifesto
results.creator_credit: Shilo McClean, Daniel Nettheim and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Hamish lives on a sheep farm in rural New South Wales, but he dreams of reading his poetry in a New York jazz club. After saving all his money for a ticket to ‘The Big Apple’, Hamish travels to Sydney where he meets aging Beat poet Bill Darcy. Bill offers to help Hamish, preparing him for his New York odyssey by teaching him the rules of the Beat lifestyle. Cast includes Steve Vidler as a cop.
Written by Tony McNamara, Daniel Nettheim and Mathew Schulz.

results.title: Wild planet
results.brief_description: George Bonicelli is an unassuming, naive and likable accountant who has his routine and mundane existence briefly injected with a large dose of fear, exhilaration, speed, colour, movement, liberation and a hint of romance when he runs into Leilah Deluxe, a 340 year old woman from the planet Ultra Terra. Original format 16 mm/colour.
